chatroom

Interface IChatroom


  • public interface IChatroom
    Author:
    Rishu Harpavat, Terrence Liu An interface that represents all Chatroom objects. 1. CREATING a Chatroom > A Chatroom object is 'owned' by the user who created it. This user holds the actual Chatroom object. > The user puts a stub to this chatroom into its local registry. > This action is NOT PART OF THE API! It is merely noted here for reference purposes. 2. JOINING a Chatroom > Any user who wishes to join this chatroom must request a stub from the registry. THIS INCLUDES THE HOST OF THE CHATROOM. > After joining, the user and the host Chatroom object exchange adapter stubs to their respective views. The host user installs the remote user's adapter into its local adapter registry, and the remote user does the same. 3. LEAVING a Chatroom > Any user who wishes to leave this chatroom merely deletes their stub. This allows ANY user (including the host!) to leave the chatroom without affecting its operation. 4. DELETING a Chatroom > Only the 'owner' of a chatroom may delete it. > Upon the call of the delete command, the Chatroom notifies all connected users to delete their stubs to that chatroom. > The Chatroom object itself is then deleted. This action is NOT PART OF THE API! It is merely noted here for reference purposes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String deleteRoom()
      Notifies all connected users to delete their stubs.
      java.lang.String getID()
      Gets the (unique) identifying ID of the chatroom.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the (non-unique) name of the chatroom.
      java.lang.String[] getUsers()
      Gets the list of current users in the chatroom.
      void removeUser()
      Removes the given user from the chatroom.
      IMsgAdpt<?> setMsgAdpt(java.lang.String userId, IMsgAdpt<?> adpt)
      Adds the given user to the chatroom.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the (non-unique) name of the chatroom. Each Chatroom has a name that users will see when finding chatrooms to connect to. This name is NOT unique.
        Returns:
        name of the chatroom

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Gets the (unique) identifying ID of the chatroom. Each Chatroom has a unique identifying ID that will be used for all internal communication. This ID is not seen by the user.
        Returns:
        ID of the chatroom

      • setMsgAdpt

        IMsgAdpt<?> setMsgAdpt(java.lang.String userId,
                       IMsgAdpt<?> adpt)
        Adds the given user to the chatroom. * Sets the local message adapter to the given value for communication with the remote host. The host Chatroom object has an adapter to its view. The remote user has an adapter to the view of the mini-MVC that's interacting with this specific chatroom. Both the Chatroom and remote view stub their respective adapters and exchange them using setLocalMsgAdpt. Once exchanged, the stubs are installed into the respective local registry that both Chatroom and remote user maintain.
        Parameters:
        userId - : IP address of user being added
        adpt - : IMsgAdpt of certain type.

      • removeUser

        void removeUser()
        Removes the given user from the chatroom. Each Chatroom has a list of current users. This method will remove the person who called it from that list of users. A user may only call removeUser on them- self.

      • getUsers

        java.lang.String[] getUsers()
        Gets the list of current users in the chatroom. Each Chatroom maintains a list of current users that any remote user can query at any time.
        Returns:
        a list of the names of current users in the chatroom

      • deleteRoom

        java.lang.String deleteRoom()
        Notifies all connected users to delete their stubs. Uses the same architecture as removeUser to tell all remote users to delete their stubs. Ensures that no users can try to talk to this chatroom anymore.
        Returns:
        string message representing success or failure of chatroom deletion notification
